chapter.title: Nepomuk MultiMedia (NMM): Description of multimedia objects like Music, Video and Images

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: This ontology extends NIE (Nepomuk Information Element ontology) and NFO (Nepomuk File Ontology) into the domains of multimedia, including Images, Videos, Music and Radio, and includes a couple of properties to support uPnP sharing.

This ontology replaces/complements NID3 and NEXIF. Those ontologies are a direct map of the respective metadata standards, which makes very difficult to map cleanly other standards (like gstreamer metadata, mp4, ogg, and so on). Besides, those ontologies contain a lot of very low level technical information that is useless to the average user of the desktop.

Our approach in NMM is to keep the minimum properties that make sense for the user, and are present in all (or almost all) specific metadata formats. A profesional photographer (or musician) who needs more fine-grained details for its documents, is free to add also nID3 information or other extensions to the ontology.

sect2.title: Images domain
sect2.para: The core of images in NMM ontology is the class nmm:Photo. It is (through a long hierarchy) a nie:InformationElement, an interpretation of some bytes. It has properties to store the basic information (camera, metering mode, white balance, flash), and inherits from nfo:Image orientation (nfo:orientation) and resolution (nfo:verticalResolution and nfo:horizontalResolution).
Note that for tags, nie:keywords (from nie:InformationElement) can be used, or the NAO ontology.

sect2.title: Radio domain
sect2.para: NMM includes classes and properties to represent analog and digital radio stations. There is a class nmm:RadioStation on the nie:InformationElement side of the ontology, representing what the user sees about that station (genre via PTY codes, icon, plus title inherited from nie:InformationElement)

A nmm:RadioStation can have one or more nmm:carrier properties representing the different frequencies (or links when it is digitial) it can be tuned. This property links the station with nfo:MediaStream, but usually it will point to one of the subclasses: nmm:DigitalRadio (if digital) or nmm:AnalogRadio (if analog). An analog station has properties as modulation and frequency, while the digial station has streaming bitrate, encoding or protocol.
Note that nfo:MediaStream refers to a flux of bytes/data, and it is on the nie:DataObject side of the ontology

refsect2.title: nmm:Artist
refsect2.para: An artist.

listitem.simpara: nmm:leadActor, nmm:producedBy, nmm:director, nmm:lyricist, nmm:composer, nmm:performer, nmm:albumArtist,

refsect2.title: nmm:Flash
refsect2.para: Enumeration of the possible values of flash property

refsect2.title: nmm:AnalogRadio
refsect2.para: FM Radio carrier signal data. Basically the frequency

listitem.simpara: nmm:isContentEncrypted, nmm:subtitle, nmm:hasSubtitle, nmm:leadActor, nmm:producedBy, nmm:director, nmm:category, nmm:MPAARating, nmm:synopsis, nmm:runTime, nmm:episodeNumber, nmm:season, nmm:isSeries, nmm:videoAlbum,

refsect2.title: nmm:ImageList
refsect2.para: An album of images

listitem.simpara: nmm:internationalStandardRecordingCode, nmm:trackNumber, nmm:lyrics, nmm:lyricist, nmm:composer, nmm:performer, nmm:beatsPerMinute, nmm:musicAlbumDisc, nmm:musicAlbum,
nmm:albumPeakGain, nmm:albumGain, nmm:albumDuration, nmm:albumTitle, nmm:albumTrackCount, nmm:albumArtist,

refsect2.title: nmm:Playlist
refsect2.para: Specific class to split MediaList in Albums and playlists.

refsect2.title: nmm:WhiteBalance
refsect2.para: Camera's white balance setting

refsect2.title: nmm:Photo
refsect2.para: A photo

listitem.simpara: nmm:isColorCorrected, nmm:isCropped, nmm:whiteBalance, nmm:meteringMode, nmm:isoSpeed, nmm:focalLength, nmm:fnumber, nmm:flash, nmm:exposureTime,

refsect2.title: nmm:RadioModulation
refsect2.para: Set of instances for analog radio modulation

refsect2.title: nmm:DigitalRadio
refsect2.para: Online Radio Stream data object (i.e. as a raw flow of bytes)

refsect2.title: nmm:RadioStation
refsect2.para: The Radio station in user terms: BBC3, Radio5, YLEX, ... It is linked with 1 or more carriers (different FM frenquencies, online sources in different qualities, etc.). Some RDS information is represented with nie properties, nie:identifier for PI, nie:title for PS

refsect2.title: nmm:MeteringMode
refsect2.para: Enumeration of different ways a camera determines exposure.

listitem.simpara: nmm:metering-mode-other, nmm:metering-mode-partial, nmm:metering-mode-pattern, nmm:metering-mode-multispot, nmm:metering-mode-spot, nmm:metering-mode-center-weighted-average, nmm:metering-mode-average,

refsect2.title: nmm:streamingBitrate
refsect2.para: Bitrate indicating the quality of the stream in Kbits (usual values 32, 64, 128...)

refsect2.title: nmm:musicAlbumDisc
refsect2.para: album disc the music belongs to

refsect2.title: nmm:musicCDIdentifier
refsect2.para: Music CD identifier to for databases like FreeDB.org. This frame is intended for music that comes from a CD, so that the CD can be identified in databases such as the CDDB. The frame consists of a binary dump of the Table Of Contents, TOC, from the CD, which is a header of 4 bytes and then 8 bytes/track on the CD plus 8 bytes for the 'lead out' making a maximum of 804 bytes. The offset to the beginning of every track on the CD should be described with a four bytes absolute CD-frame address per track, and not with absolute time.

refsect2.title: nmm:focalLength
refsect2.para: A measure of how strongly the lens converges light

refsect2.title: nmm:albumDuration
refsect2.para: Duration of the album

refsect2.title: nmm:setNumber
refsect2.para: Disc number of album disc

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nmm:frequency
refsect2.para: Frequency in the Radio spectrum in Khz (note that usually FM frequencies are in MHz)

refsect2.title: nmm:carrier
refsect2.para: Signal where a radio can be tuned in. There can be more than one.

refsect2.title: nmm:modulation
refsect2.para: Modulation used in the frequency (AM or FM)

refsect2.title: nmm:isForHearingImpaired
refsect2.para: Does text stream contain helper tags for hearing-impaired such as <steps in hallway>

refsect2.title: nmm:composer
refsect2.para: Composer

refsect2.title: nmm:albumTrackCount
refsect2.para: Track count of album

refsect2.title: nmm:isoSpeed
refsect2.para: Measure of a photographic film's sensitivity to light as ISO value

refsect2.title: nmm:albumTitle
refsect2.para: nmm:albumTitle is deprecated, use nie:title instead, extractors still need updating

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nmm:exposureTime
refsect2.para: Exposure time of the photo

refsect2.title: nmm:dlnaProfile
refsect2.para: DLNA profile of the content, like MP3, MPEG_TS_HD_US, LPCM etc

refsect2.title: nmm:meteringMode
refsect2.para: Metering mode refers to the way in which a camera determines the exposure.

refsect2.title: nmm:radioPTY
refsect2.para: PTY Code (content description) as integer. RDS specs define the translations into human readable descriptions for various languages

refsect2.title: nmm:fnumber
refsect2.para: The diameter of the entrance pupil in terms of the focal length of the lens

refsect2.title: nmm:albumArtist
refsect2.para: main artists of the album

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nmm:performer
refsect2.para: Performer

refsect2.title: nmm:albumPeakGain
refsect2.para: Peak Gain of album

refsect2.title: nmm:uPnPShared
refsect2.para: Tells the uPnP MediaServer (e.g. Rygel) whether to export/share the resource or not

refsect2.title: nmm:protocol
refsect2.para: Protocol used for the streaming (HTTP, RTSP)

refsect2.title: nmm:radioIcon
refsect2.para: Image used as logo for a radio station

refsect2.title: nmm:flash
refsect2.para: Specifies whether flash was used

refsect2.title: nmm:albumDiscAlbum
refsect2.para: Album of the disc

refsect2.title: nmm:beatsPerMinute
refsect2.para: beats per minute

refsect2.title: nmm:lyricist
refsect2.para: Lyricist

refsect2.title: nmm:artistName
refsect2.para: Name of the artist

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nmm:dlnaMime
refsect2.para: Mimetypes as defined for DLNA (occasional differences compared to xdg-mime)

refsect2.title: nmm:albumGain
refsect2.para: Gain of album

refsect2.title: nmm:musicAlbum
refsect2.para: album the music belongs to

refsect2.title: nmm:trackNumber
refsect2.para: Track number of the music in its album

refsect2.title: nmm:internationalStandardRecordingCode
refsect2.para: ISRC ID. Format: 'CC-XXX-YY-NNNNN'

refsect2.title: nmm:alternativeMedia
refsect2.para: Link between to different version of the same media. This is used for instances in uPnp where the server can provide the same video in different resolutions and codecs

refsect2.title: nmm:encoding
refsect2.para: Encoding of the radio. It is a property of the streaming, that it is known before hand, so the applications can choose the encoding they understand.
